techmeme.title: Circle's S-1 shows that 60% of the 24M shares being sold in its IPO come from existing stakeholders rather than the company, a highly unusual move in a tech IPO (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
Okta reports Q1 revenue up 12% YoY to $688M, vs. $680M est., and maintains its FY 2026 guidance due to macroeconomic uncertainties; OKTA drops 12%+ after hours (Samantha Subin/CNBC)
Block plans to roll out bitcoin payments on Square in H2 2025; the system runs on the Lightning Network and lets merchants accept bitcoin via Square's hardware (MacKenzie Sigalos/CNBC)
Circle aims to raise up to $624M in its US IPO, offering 24M shares at $24-$26 each, valuing it at ~$5.65B, or ~$6.7B fully diluted, at the top of the range (Bloomberg)
Zscaler agrees to acquire Red Canary, a provider of managed detection and response services, for an undisclosed sum; the deal is expected to close in August (Greg Otto/CyberScoop)
